data.title: Men's Basketball's Bob Shaw: Where Are They Now?

data.text:
In the latest installment of "Where Are They Now?", we learn this week about former Bison hoopster, Bob Shaw, who played basketball under legendary Don Meyer from 1977-81. We learned about his teammates, his favorite memory as a Bison and his family when he sat down this week for a brief conversation with LipscombSports.com.

What teammates were most memorable?

Ed Matlock, Alan Banks and Rick Kyle. Because of their character, they were hard-working and their Christian influence.

What degree have you earned?

B.S. Business Management - David Lipscomb College

Why did you attend Lipscomb?

I thought it was only to pursue my basketball career, but the Lord had much bigger plans for me that I didn't fully realize until later. Go God!

What is your favorite athletic memory at Lipscomb?

Definitely the relationships with my teammates would be first. Also "Bison Day" and "Battle of the Boulevard" with the crowd noise and excitement.

Who influenced your athletic career at Lipscomb?

All my coaches and teammates and especially Mark and Mary French. They were basketball boosters that sort of adopted me and we became family, still to this day. They are some of the finest Christian people in the world.

What do you remember about Lipscomb campus life during your time here?

The relationships and the spiritual atmosphere. All the influences for good and for growth.

What are the most valuable lessons you learned in your time at Lipscomb?

Hard work, organization, prayer and putting God first in all you do.

Who were your favorite professors?

Ralph Nance and Carl McKelvy

Where did you grow up?

Colorado

What do you do now?

I am the President/Owner at McPherson - Shaw Inc. General Contractors.

Tell us about your family:

My wife, Teresa (McPherson '82), and I met at Lipscomb and we've been married for 38 wonderful years. We have two grown children: Jessica Douglas (Shaw '08) and Jonathan Shaw. We also have a wonderful son-in-law, Nathan Douglas, and our special miracle grandson, William Douglas.

FAST FINISH:

Favorite Bible scripture: Psalm 143:8

Person I most admire: Jessica Shaw Douglas

Rather ride or drive? Drive

Pick one â€“ salad or dessert: Dessert

Dream vacation spot: Mountains

Early morning or late night person? Early morning

You can reach Bob by email: bshaw@mcphersonshaw.com, on Facebook (Bob and Teresa Shaw) or on Instagram (@builderbob59).
